page.title: 13Leckiebank and Mairsland
page.content: Leckiebank Farm consists of{500 {acres}of 2nd and 3rd grade land. Some of the field names are{Piggery, {Spunky, Jenny's Park, The Den, The {Coffin}and{Newhill.} Mr. Kerr is the dairy man. He looks after{British Friesian cattle.}He milks them at 4.30am every morning and again at 2.30pm. The cattle are fed grass in Summer and silage, cattle cake and barley in Winter. The present owner of{Mairsland Farm} {(116 acres)}is{Mr. Ferguson}who also farms at Foxton (240 acres) near Cupar. The only livestock that are kept are cattle for beef.{Mr. Findlay a previous owner of the farm, developed more than a hundred types of potato. Among these are{Majestic }and{ {Eldorado. Mr Ferguson}grows none of the old Findlay varieties which are no longer so popular.
